revised_title: An Unusual Glandular Substance Found in an Ox
tldr: A large, glandular substance found between the heart and pericardium of an ox was examined by the Philosophical Society of Oxford. The substance resembled a heart in shape but was flatter and contained a gritty substance in the septum cordis. The ox's lungs also contained cysts with fluid-filled matter. The unusual growths may have contributed to the ox's difficulty in breathing and movement.
